components.description: The fruit of a rich red strawberry dotted with seeds and crowned with green leaves. Google previously depicted the fruit in orange.
components.title: Strawberry

description: The fruit of a rich red strawberry dotted with seeds and crowned with green leaves. Google previously depicted the fruit in orange.
title: Strawberry

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Fruit and vegetable symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A bright red garden strawberry. A sweet fruit generally¬†referred to simply as a strawberry. Strawberry was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 i http://emojipedia.org/strawberry/
emoji_net_data.name: strawberry

bn:00100064a: That can be eaten without harm; innocuous to humans; suitable for consumption.
That can be eaten without harm, non-toxic to humans; suitable for consumption.

bn:00111540a: Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.

bn:00103380a: Tasting or smelling richly of or as of fruit

bn:00106506a: Fully developed or matured and ready to be eaten or used
Fully developed; grown up in terms of physical appearance, behaviour or thinking; ripe.
Maturated or suppurated; ready to discharge; -- said of sores, tumors, etc.
Maturated or suppurated, of sores and tumors.

bn:13644510a: Containing or having the flavor of strawberries.

bn:13644511a: Flavored with ethyl methylphenylglycidate, an artificial compound which is said to resemble the taste of strawberries.

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00036686n: The ripened reproductive body of a seed plant
Fruit, in broad terms, is a structure of a plant that contains its seeds.
The seed-bearing part of a plant, often edible, colourful/colorful and fragrant, produced from a floral ovary after fertilization.
A fully matured plant ovary with or without other floral or shoot parts united with it at maturity.
In botany, a fruit is a part of a flowering plant that derives from specific tissues of the flower, one or more ovaries, and in some cases accessory tissues.

bn:00010066n: Any of numerous small and pulpy edible fruits; used as desserts or in making jams and jellies and preserves
The botanical definition of a berry is a fleshy fruit produced from a single flower and containing one ovary.
A soft fruit which develops from a single ovary and contains seeds not encased in pits.
A soft fruit which develops from a superior ovary and contains seeds not encased in pits.
Soft fruit developing from a superior ovary and containing seeds not encased in pits.

bn:00074577n: The juicy, usually red, edible fruit of certain plants of the genus Fragaria.
Fruit of several species of plants of the genus Fragaria.
Any of various low perennial herbs with many runners and bearing white flowers followed by edible fruits having many small achenes scattered on the surface of an enlarged red pulpy berry
The garden strawberry is a widely grown hybrid species of the genus Fragaria.
Strawberries are flowering plants in a genus within the rose family, Rosaceae, known for their edible fruits.
The most common strawberry species worldwide, created in the 18th century as a hybrid of the Virginia strawberry and the Chilean strawberry.

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

apple_vendor_description: Apple's strawberry emoji is a delightful depiction of the ripe fruit, featuring a vibrant red exterior with carefully rendered seeds and a textured, glossy finish that highlights its juiciness.  The stem and leaves are a fresh green, exhibiting Apple's signature smooth gradients and realistic lighting for a visually appealing and appetizing look.  This emoji is commonly used to express sweetness, deliciousness, or a summery feeling in digital conversations on Apple devices.
